subject: Real Estate
title: The Rise of Institutional Home Buying
description: A quick, practical guide to The Rise of Institutional Home Buying.

hook.text: After 2008, Wall Street firms bought 300,000+ foreclosed homes and turned them into rental empires.

buildup.text: Invitation Homes and American Homes 4 Rent purchased entire neighborhoods, sight unseen, at auction.

discovery.text: Algorithms selected homes in markets with strong rental demand. Humans never visited before buying.

twist.text: By 2023, institutional landlords owned roughly 5% of U.S. single-family rentals and the share keeps growing.

climax.text: Critics say Wall Street is pricing out families. Defenders say institutions provide professionally managed rentals.

punchline.text: Your landlord isn't a person anymore. It's a fund.

quiz.question: How did institutional buyers select foreclosed homes to purchase?
